<line: 22> )

<line: 24> Corporation;   
<line: 25> )

<line: 27> )

<line: 29> )

<line: 31> ) 
<line: 32> ) 
<line: 33> Defendants. 
<line: 34> ) 

[TITLE]
<line: 36> MOTION FOR LEAVE TO AMEND COMPLAINT 

[TEXT]
<line: 38> The plaintiffs, Andrew Terrell and George Terrell, by one of their attorneys, David L. 
<line: 39> Goldberg, move this honorable court for leave to file their Amended Complaint.  In support, the 
<line: 40> plaintiffs states as follows: 

[TEXT]
<line: 42> 1. 
<line: 43> Plaintiffs filed their Complaint at Law in state court on March 17, 2008 (Cook 
<line: 44> County, Illinois Docket No.2008 L 2956), naming Peter Diangi, Individually and as Employee or 
<line: 45> Agent of Silver Lake Country Club, Inc., and as Police Officer of Orland Park, a Municipal 
<line: 46> Corporation; Silver Lake Country Club, Inc.; and Village Of Orland Park, a Municipal 
<line: 47> Corporation as defendants. 

[TEXT]
<line: 49> 2. 
<line: 50> On April 29, 2008, the case was removed to the United States District Court. 
<line: 51> 3. 
<line: 52> Plaintiffs seek leave to file their Amended Complaint, instanter to add theories of 
<line: 53> liability based upon general negligence against defendants Peter Diangi, Individually and as 
<line: 54> Employee or Agent of  Silver Lake Country Club, Inc. and Silver Lake Country Club.  (A copy of 

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 2 of 2

[TEXT]
<line: 4> the plaintiff’s proposed Amended Complaint is attached herein as Exhibit “1” and is 
<line: 5> incorporated by reference.) 

[TEXT]
<line: 7> WHEREFORE, the plaintiffs, Andrew Terrell and George Terrell, by their attorney, 
<line: 8> David L. Goldberg, respectfully request an order granting her leave to file their Amended 
<line: 9> Complaint, instanter. 

[TEXT]
<line: 11> Respectfully submitted, 

[TEXT]
<line: 13> By: ____________________________ 
<line: 14> Attorney for the Plaintiffs 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> David L. Goldberg 
<line: 17> RUBIN MACHADO & ROSENBLUM LTD. 
<line: 18> Attorneys for the Plaintiff 
<line: 19> Andrew Terrell and George Terrell  
<line: 20> 120 West Madison Street, Suite 400 
<line: 21> Chicago, Illinois 60602

<line: 32> ) 
<line: 33> VILLAGE OF ORLAND PARK, a Municipal  
<line: 34> ) 
<line: 35> Corporation,  
<line: 36> ) 
<line: 37> ) 
<line: 38> Defendants. 
<line: 39> ) 

[TITLE]
<line: 41> AMENDED COMPLAINT AT LAW 

[TEXT]
<line: 43> NOW COME the Plaintiffs, GEORGE TERRELL and ANDREW TERRELL, by and 
<line: 44> through their attorneys, RUBIN, MACHADO & ROSENBLUM, LTD., and, complaining of the 
<line: 45> Defendants, PETER DIANGI, Individually and as Employee or Agent of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 46> Club, and as Police Officer of Orland Park; SILVER LAKES COUNTRY CLUB (“SILVER 
<line: 47> LAKE”); and VILLAGE OF ORLAND PARK, a Municipal Corporation (“ORLAND PARK”), 
<line: 48> states as follows: 

[TITLE]
<line: 50> COMMON FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS 

[TEXT]
<line: 52> 1. 
<line: 53> At all times relevant herein, the Plaintiffs, ANDREW TERRELL and GEORGE 
<line: 54> TERRELL were residents of the County of Cook and State of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 56> 2. 
<line: 57> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was a resident of 
<line: 58> the County of Cook and State of Illinois.  

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 2 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 3. 
<line: 5> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was employed by 
<line: 6> the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, as a security guard. 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> 4. 
<line: 9> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was employed by 
<line: 10> the Defendant, ORLAND PARK, as a police officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 5. 
<line: 13> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, was a duly licensed 
<line: 14> corporation, incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country Club 
<line: 15> and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County of Cook, and State 
<line: 16> of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 18> 6. 
<line: 19>  On or about March 18, 2006, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, and his fiancé 
<line: 20> were married at Queen of Martyrs Church in Evergreen Park.  Immediately after the wedding 
<line: 21> ceremony, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, his fiancé, and various other members of the 
<line: 22> wedding guests, including the Plaintiff GEORGE TERRELL, attended a wedding reception at 
<line: 23> Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 25> 7. 
<line: 26> The Defendant, PETER DIANGI, grabbed the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, 
<line: 27> by the arm. 

[TEXT]
<line: 29> 8. 
<line: 30> Prior grabbing the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, the Defendant, PETER 
<line: 31> DIANGI, did not identify himself as a security guard or other employee of SILVER LAKE, nor 
<line: 32> did he identify himself as a police officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> 9. 
<line: 35> Subsequent to grabbing the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, the Defendant, 
<line: 36> PETER DIANGI, grabbed ANDREW TERRELL by the neck.  A melee ensued as wedding 
<line: 37> guests attempted to defend the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL. 

[TEXT]
<line: 39> 10. 
<line: 40> At all relevant times, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was dressed in “plain 
<line: 41> clothes”, and was not wearing a police uniform. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 43> 2

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 3 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 11. 
<line: 5> As a result of the aforestated melee, the Plaintiffs, ANDREW TERRELL and 
<line: 6> GEORGE TERRELL, were arrested and charged with battery. 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> 12. 
<line: 9> The arrests of the Plaintiffs were made under false pretenses, given that the 
<line: 10> Defendant, PETER DIANGI, instigated the events leading to the aforesaid arrests. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 13. 
<line: 13> The Defendant, PETER DIANGI, engaged in conduct against the plaintiffs, which 
<line: 14> conduct included striking the plaintiffs, grabbing the plaintiffs, and spraying the plaintiffs with 
<line: 15> pepper spray. 

[TITLE]
<line: 17> COUNT I --BATTERY 

[TITLE]
<line: 19> (Andrew Terrell v. Peter Diangi) 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 22> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13  inclusive of Count I, as though 
<line: 23> fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 25> 14. 
<line: 26> The conduct and force used by PETER DIANGI toward the Plaintiff, ANDREW 
<line: 27> TERRELL, was intentional, malicious, excessive and in reckless disregard of the Plaintiffs' 
<line: 28> constitutional rights.  Moreover, the use of force used against the Plaintiff was excessive. 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> 15. 
<line: 31> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 32> serious physical injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including 
<line: 33> physical and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 35> 16. 
<line: 36> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 37> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 39> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 40> against the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 
<line: 41> 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 43> 3

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 4 of 26

[TITLE]
<line: 4> COUNT II – ASSAULT 

[TITLE]
<line: 6> (Andrew Terrell v. Peter Diangi) 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 9> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count II, as though 
<line: 10> fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 14. 
<line: 13> The Defendants’ conduct placed Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL in apprehension 
<line: 14> of immediate and imminent harm to his well being and safety, and he suffered great shame and 
<line: 15> humiliation and injury to his dignity and feelings, upsetting her mentally, emotionally and 
<line: 16> psychologically. 

[TEXT]
<line: 18> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 19> against the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 
<line: 20> 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 22> COUNT III -- NEGLIGENCE 

[TITLE]
<line: 24> (Andrew Terrell v. Peter Diangi) 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 1. 
<line: 27> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was employed by 
<line: 28> the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, as a security guard. 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> 2. 
<line: 31> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, was a duly licensed 
<line: 32> corporation, incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country Club 
<line: 33> and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County of Cook, and State 
<line: 34> of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 3. 
<line: 37>  On or about March 18, 2006, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, and his fiancé 
<line: 38> were married at Queen of Martyrs Church in Evergreen Park.  Immediately after the wedding 
<line: 39> ceremony, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, his fiancé, and various other members of the 

[ABANDON]
<line: 41> 4

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 5 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> wedding guests, including the Plaintiff GEORGE TERRELL, attended a wedding reception at 
<line: 5> Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 7> 4. 
<line: 8> During the course of the reception, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was engaged 
<line: 9> in his ordinary duties as a security guard and was working in his capacity as employee or agent 
<line: 10> of the Defendant, SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 5. 
<line: 13> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant PETER DIANGI owed a duty of 
<line: 14> ordinary care to the Plaintiff while performing his tasks as a security officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> 6. 
<line: 17> On March 18, 2006, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, breached his aforesaid duty 
<line: 18> by engaging in one or more of the following negligent acts or omissions: 

[TEXT]
<line: 20> a. 
<line: 21> negligently failed to identify himself as a security guard or employee of 
<line: 22> Silver Lake;  
<line: 23> b. 
<line: 24> negligently pushed the Plaintiff; 
<line: 25> c. 
<line: 26> negligently sprayed the Plaintiff with pepper spray; 
<line: 27> d. 
<line: 28> negligently attempted to physically restrain the plaintiff; and/or 
<line: 29> e. 
<line: 30> was otherwise negligent. 

[TEXT]
<line: 32> 7. 
<line: 33> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 34> serious physical injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including 
<line: 35> physical and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 37> 8. 
<line: 38> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 39> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 41> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 42> against the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 
<line: 43> 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 45> 5

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 6 of 26

[TITLE]
<line: 4> COUNT IV – BATTERY 

[TITLE]
<line: 6> (Andrew Terrell v. Silver Lake) 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 9> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count III, as though 
<line: 10> fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 14. 
<line: 13> The conduct and force used by PETER DIANGI toward the Plaintiff, ANDREW 
<line: 14> TERRELL, was intentional, malicious and excessive and in reckless disregard of the Plaintiffs' 
<line: 15> constitutional rights.  Moreover, the use of force used against the Plaintiff was excessive. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 15. 
<line: 18> At all times relevant herein the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was engaged in his 
<line: 19> ordinary duties as a security guard and employee, agent, apparent agent, and/or servant of the 
<line: 20> Defendant, SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 22> 16. 
<line: 23> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI knew that the 
<line: 24> Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, was legally upon the premises of Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 17. 
<line: 27> The Defendant’s conduct in striking the Plaintiff and spraying the Plaintiff with 
<line: 28> mace was unjustified and excessive. 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> 18. 
<line: 31> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 32> serious injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical 
<line: 33> and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 35> 19. 
<line: 36> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 37> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 39> 20. 
<line: 40> The Defendant, SILVER LAKE, is vicariously liable for the actions and conduct 
<line: 41> of PETER DIANGI. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 43> 6

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 7 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 5> against the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 00/100 
<line: 6> DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 8> COUNT V – ASSAULT 

[TITLE]
<line: 10> (Andrew Terrell v. Silver Lake) 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 13> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count IV, as though 
<line: 14> fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> 14. 
<line: 17> The conduct of Defendant, SILVER LAKE, by and through its employee and 
<line: 18> agent, PETER DIANGI, placed Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, in apprehension of immediate 
<line: 19> and imminent harm to his well being and safety, and he suffered great shame and humiliation 
<line: 20> and injury to his dignity and feelings, upsetting them mentally, emotionally and psychologically. 

[TEXT]
<line: 22> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 23> against the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 00/100 
<line: 24> DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 26> COUNT VI -- NEGLIGENCE 

[TITLE]
<line: 28> (Andrew Terrell v. Silver Lake) 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> 1. 
<line: 31> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, was a duly licensed 
<line: 32> corporation, incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country Club 
<line: 33> and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County of Cook, and State 
<line: 34> of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 2. 
<line: 37> Prior to March 18, 2006, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, hired and employed the 
<line: 38> Defendant PETER DIANGI, as a security guard at the Silver Lake Country Club. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 40> 7

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 8 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 3. 
<line: 5> On or about March 18, 2006, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was working as a 
<line: 6> security guard and performing his ordinary duties as an employee or agent of the Defendant, 
<line: 7> SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> 4. 
<line: 10>  On or about March 18, 2006, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, and his fiancé 
<line: 11> were married at Queen of Martyrs Church in Evergreen Park.  Immediately after the wedding 
<line: 12> ceremony, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, his fiancé, and various other members of the 
<line: 13> wedding guests, including the Plaintiff GEORGE TERRELL, attended a wedding reception at 
<line: 14> Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> 5. 
<line: 17> During the course of the reception, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was engaged 
<line: 18> in his ordinary duties as a security guard and was working in his capacity as employee or agent 
<line: 19> of the Defendant, SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> 6. 
<line: 22> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant SILVER LAKE, through its 
<line: 23> employees and agents, including PETER DIANGI, owed duties of ordinary care to the Plaintiff 
<line: 24> to hire well-qualified security personnel, and to ensure that the security acted appropriately when 
<line: 25> providing security. 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> 7. 
<line: 28> On March 18, 2006, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, through its employees 
<line: 29> and/or agents, including the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, breached its aforesaid duties to the 
<line: 30> Plaintiff by engaging in one or more of the following negligent acts or omissions: 

[TEXT]
<line: 32> a. 
<line: 33> negligently failed to properly train the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, as a 
<line: 34> security guard responsible for providing security to patron during social 
<line: 35> events at SILVER LAKE; 
<line: 36> b. 
<line: 37> negligently failed to adequately supervise the Defendant, PETER 
<line: 38> DIANGI, during the performance of his duties as a security guard; 
<line: 39> c. 
<line: 40> negligently permitted the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, to work as a 
<line: 41> security guard without sufficient assistance or supervision; 

[ABANDON]
<line: 43> 8

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 9 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> d. 
<line: 5> negligently failed to provide adequate security personnel to assist the 
<line: 6> Defendant, PETER DIANGI, in providing security; 
<line: 7> e. 
<line: 8> negligently hired the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, as a security officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 10> 8. 
<line: 11> In addition to the aforesaid negligent acts and/or omissions, the Defendant, 
<line: 12> SILVER LAKE, is vicariously liable for the negligent acts and/or omissions of the Defendant, 
<line: 13> PETER DIANGI, as alleged in Count III above. 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> 9. 
<line: 16> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 17> serious physical injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including 
<line: 18> physical and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 20> 10. 
<line: 21> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 22> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 24> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 25> against the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 00/100 
<line: 26> DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 28> COUNT VII – BATTERY 

[TITLE]
<line: 30> (Andrew Terrell v. Orland Park) 

[TEXT]
<line: 32> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 33> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count V, as though 
<line: 34> fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 14. 
<line: 37> The conduct and force used by PETER DIANGI as stated herein was intentional, 
<line: 38> malicious, excessive and in reckless disregard of the Plaintiffs' constitutional rights.  Moreover, 
<line: 39> the use of force used against the Plaintiff was excessive. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 41> 9

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 10 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 15. 
<line: 5> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 6> serious injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical 
<line: 7> and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> 16. 
<line: 10> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 11> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 13> 17. 
<line: 14> The Defendant, ORLAND PARK, is vicariously liable for the actionable conduct 
<line: 15> of its employees, agents, and/or servants, including PETER DIANGI. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 18> against the Defendant, ORLAND PARK, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 
<line: 19> 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 21> COUNT VIII – ASSAULT 

[TITLE]
<line: 23> (Andrew Terrell v. Orland Park) 

[TEXT]
<line: 25> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 26> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count VI, as though 
<line: 27> fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 29> 14. 
<line: 30> The conduct of Defendant, ORLAND PARK, by and through its employee and/or 
<line: 31> agent, PETER DIANGI, placed Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, in apprehension of immediate 
<line: 32> and imminent harm to his well being and safety, and he suffered great shame and humiliation 
<line: 33> and injury to his dignity and feelings, upsetting him mentally, emotionally and psychologically. 

[TEXT]
<line: 35> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 36> against the Defendant, ORLAND PARK, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 
<line: 37> 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 39> 10

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 11 of 26

[TITLE]
<line: 4> COUNT IX – WILLFUL & WANTON 

[TITLE]
<line: 6> (Andrew Terrell v. Peter Diangi) 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 9> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count VII, as 
<line: 10> though fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 14. 
<line: 13> Pursuant to 745 ILCS 10/2-202, police officers are liable for injuries resulting 
<line: 14> from their willful and wanton acts or omissions while engaged in the execution or enforcement 
<line: 15> of the law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 15. 
<line: 18> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI, knew that the 
<line: 19> Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, was legally upon the premises of Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> 16. 
<line: 22> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI was engaged in the 
<line: 23> execution or enforcement of the law when he grabbed and/or struck the Plaintiff, ANDREW 
<line: 24> TERRELL.  Moreover, OFFICER METELSKI engaged in willful and wanton conduct during 
<line: 25> said execution or enforcement of the law by using excessive force in attempting to arrest 
<line: 26> ANDREW TERRELL.    

[TEXT]
<line: 28> 17. 
<line: 29> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 30> serious injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical 
<line: 31> and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 33> 18. 
<line: 34> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 35> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 37> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 38> against the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 
<line: 39> 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 41> 11

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 12 of 26

[TITLE]
<line: 4> COUNT X – WILLFUL & WANTON 

[TITLE]
<line: 6> (Andrew Terrell v. Orland Park) 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 9> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count VIII, as 
<line: 10> though fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 14. 
<line: 13> Pursuant to 745 ILCS 10/2-202, municipalities are liable for injuries resulting 
<line: 14> from willful and wanton acts or omissions of police officers while engaged in the execution or 
<line: 15> enforcement of the law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 15. 
<line: 18> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI knew that the 
<line: 19> Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, was lawfully upon the premises of Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> 16. 
<line: 22> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI was engaged in the 
<line: 23> execution or enforcement of the law on behalf when he grabbed and/or struck the Plaintiff, 
<line: 24> ANDREW TERRELL.  Moreover, PETER DIANGI engaged in willful and wanton conduct 
<line: 25> during said execution or enforcement of the law by using excessive force in attempting to arrest 
<line: 26> ANDREW TERRELL.   

[TEXT]
<line: 28> 17. 
<line: 29> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the ORLAND PARK, by and 
<line: 30> through its employee and/or agent, PETER DIANGI, the Plaintiff suffered serious injuries.  
<line: 31> Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical and emotional 
<line: 32> pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> 18. 
<line: 35> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of ORLAND PARK 
<line: 36> aforementioned conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 38> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 39> against the Defendant, VILLAGE of ORLAND PARK, in a sum in excess of FIFTY 

[ABANDON]
<line: 41> 12

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 13 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> THOUSAND AND 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might 
<line: 5> deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 7> COUNT XI – 42 U.S.C. §1983 

[TITLE]
<line: 9> (Andrew Terrell) 

[TEXT]
<line: 11> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 12> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count IX, as though 
<line: 13> fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> 13. 
<line: 16> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI knew that the 
<line: 17> Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, was legally upon the premises of Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 19> 14. 
<line: 20> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI was engaged in the 
<line: 21> execution or enforcement of the law, and was acting under the color of authority when he 
<line: 22> engaged in the conduct alleged herein, and when he arrested the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL.   

[TEXT]
<line: 24> 15. 
<line: 25> The conduct engaged in by PETER DIANGI was intentional, malicious, and with 
<line: 26> deliberate indifference to the Plaintiff’s rights under the Constitution.   

[TEXT]
<line: 28> 16. 
<line: 29> The conduct of the Defendants deprived the Plaintiff of the following rights, 
<line: 30> privileges, and immunities secured to him by the Constitution of the United States: 

[TEXT]
<line: 32> a. 
<line: 33> The right of plaintiff to be secure in his person and effects against 
<line: 34> unreasonable search and seizure under the Fourth and Fourteenth Amendments to the 
<line: 35> Constitution of the United States (Art. IV, U.S. Constitution, Art. XIV, U.S. Constitution.); and 
<line: 36> b. 
<line: 37> The right of Plaintiff not to be deprived of life, liberty, or property without 
<line: 38> due process of law, and the right to the equal protection of the laws, secured by the Fourteenth 
<line: 39> Amendment of the Constitution of the United States (Art. XIV, U.S. Constitution). 

[ABANDON]
<line: 41> 13

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 14 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 17. 
<line: 5> Prior to March 18, 2006, ORLAND PARK failed to properly train and supervise 
<line: 6> its officers, including, but not limited to PETER DIANGI regarding proper procedures to be used 
<line: 7> in apprehending a suspect, including the proper use of force. 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> 18. 
<line: 10> In addition, prior to March 18, 2006, ORLAND PARK failed to discipline its 
<line: 11> officers, including, but not limited to PETER DIANGI, following excessive use of force by 
<line: 12> police such that its officers, including, but not limited to PETER DIANGI, were led to believe 
<line: 13> that the consequences of failing to follow proper procedure in the exercise of force were minimal 
<line: 14> or nonexistent. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> 19. 
<line: 17> As a result of the failure of ORLAND PARK to properly train, supervise and 
<line: 18> discipline its officers, including, but not limited to that of PETER DIANGI, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 19> serious injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical 
<line: 20> and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 22> 20. 
<line: 23> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 24> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 27> against the Defendants, ORLAND PARK and PETER DIANGI, in a sum in excess of FIFTY 
<line: 28> THOUSAND AND 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might 
<line: 29> deem appropriate.

<line: 6> TERRELL, was intentional, malicious, excessive and in reckless disregard of the Plaintiffs' 
<line: 7> constitutional rights.  Moreover, the use of force used against the Plaintiff was excessive. 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> 15. 
<line: 10> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 11> serious physical injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including 
<line: 12> physical and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]

<line: 16> conduct.

<line: 34> psychologically.

[TITLE]
<line: 4> COUNT XIV -- NEGLIGENCE 

[TITLE]
<line: 6> (George Terrell v. Peter Diangi) 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> 1. 
<line: 9> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was employed by 
<line: 10> the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, as a security guard. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 2. 
<line: 13> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, was a duly licensed 
<line: 14> corporation, incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country Club 
<line: 15> and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County of Cook, and State 
<line: 16> of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 18> 3. 
<line: 19>  On or about March 18, 2006, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, and his fiancé 
<line: 20> were married at Queen of Martyrs Church in Evergreen Park.  Immediately after the wedding 
<line: 21> ceremony, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, his fiancé, and various other members of the 
<line: 22> wedding guests, including the Plaintiff GEORGE TERRELL, attended a wedding reception at 
<line: 23> Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 25> 4. 
<line: 26> During the course of the reception, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was engaged 
<line: 27> in his ordinary duties as a security guard and was working in his capacity as employee or agent 
<line: 28> of the Defendant, SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> 5. 
<line: 31> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant PETER DIANGI owed a duty of 
<line: 32> ordinary care to the Plaintiff while performing his tasks as a security officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> 6. 
<line: 35> On March 18, 2006, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, breached his aforesaid duty 
<line: 36> by engaging in one or more of the following negligent acts or omissions: 

[TEXT]
<line: 38> a. 
<line: 39> negligently failed to identify himself as a security guard or employee of 
<line: 40> Silver Lake;  
<line: 41> b. 
<line: 42> negligently pushed the Plaintiff; 
<line: 43> c. 
<line: 44> negligently sprayed the Plaintiff with pepper spray; 

[ABANDON]
<line: 46> 16

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 17 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> d. 
<line: 5> negligently attempted to physically restrain the plaintiff; and/or 
<line: 6> e. 
<line: 7> was otherwise negligent. 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> 7. 
<line: 10> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 11> serious physical injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including 
<line: 12> physical and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 14> 8. 
<line: 15> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 16> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 18> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 19> against the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 
<line: 20> 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 22> COUNT XV – BATTERY 

[TITLE]
<line: 24> (George Terrell v. Silver Lake) 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 27> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count XII, as 
<line: 28> though fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> 14. 
<line: 31> The conduct and force used by PETER DIANGI toward the Plaintiff, GEORGE 
<line: 32> TERRELL, was intentional, malicious and excessive and in reckless disregard of the Plaintiffs' 
<line: 33> constitutional rights.  Moreover, the use of force used against the Plaintiff was excessive. 

[TEXT]
<line: 35> 15. 
<line: 36> At all times relevant herein the Defendant PETER DIANGI, was engaged in his 
<line: 37> ordinary duties as a security guard and employee, agent, apparent agent, and/or servant of the 
<line: 38> Defendant, SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 40> 16. 
<line: 41> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI knew that the 
<line: 42> Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, was legally upon the premises of Silver Lake Country Club. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 44> 17

<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 18 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 17.

<line: 6> mace was unjustified and excessive. 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> 18. 
<line: 9> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 10> serious injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical 
<line: 11> and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 13> 19. 
<line: 14> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 15> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 20.

<line: 19> of PETER DIANGI. 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 22> against the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 00/100 
<line: 23> DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate.

[TITLE]
<line: 8> COUNT XVII -- NEGLIGENCE 

[TITLE]
<line: 10> (Andrew Terrell v. Silver Lake) 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 1. 
<line: 13> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, was a duly licensed 
<line: 14> corporation, incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country Club 
<line: 15> and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County of Cook, and State 
<line: 16> of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 18> 2. 
<line: 19> Prior to March 18, 2006, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, hired and employed the 
<line: 20> Defendant PETER DIANGI, as a security guard at the Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 22> 3. 
<line: 23> On or about March 18, 2006, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was working as a 
<line: 24> security guard and performing his ordinary duties as an employee or agent of the Defendant, 
<line: 25> SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> 4. 
<line: 28>  On or about March 18, 2006, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, and his fiancé 
<line: 29> were married at Queen of Martyrs Church in Evergreen Park.  Immediately after the wedding 
<line: 30> ceremony, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, his fiancé, and various other members of the 
<line: 31> wedding guests, including the Plaintiff GEORGE TERRELL, attended a wedding reception at 
<line: 32> Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> 5. 
<line: 35> During the course of the reception, the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, was engaged 
<line: 36> in his ordinary duties as a security guard and was working in his capacity as employee or agent 
<line: 37> of the Defendant, SILVER LAKE. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 39> 19

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 20 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 6. 
<line: 5> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant SILVER LAKE, through its 
<line: 6> employees and agents, including PETER DIANGI, owed duties of ordinary care to the Plaintiff 
<line: 7> to hire well-qualified security personnel, and to ensure that the security acted appropriately when 
<line: 8> providing security. 

[TEXT]
<line: 10> 7. 
<line: 11> On March 18, 2006, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, through its employees 
<line: 12> and/or agents, including the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, breached its aforesaid duties to the 
<line: 13> Plaintiff by engaging in one or more of the following negligent acts or omissions: 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> a. 
<line: 16> negligently failed to properly train the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, as a 
<line: 17> security guard responsible for providing security to patron during social 
<line: 18> events at SILVER LAKE; 
<line: 19> b. 
<line: 20> negligently failed to adequately supervise the Defendant, PETER 
<line: 21> DIANGI, during the performance of his duties as a security guard; 
<line: 22> c. 
<line: 23> negligently permitted the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, to work as a 
<line: 24> security guard without sufficient assistance or supervision; 
<line: 25> d. 
<line: 26> negligently failed to provide adequate security personnel to assist the 
<line: 27> Defendant, PETER DIANGI, in providing security; 
<line: 28> e. 
<line: 29> negligently hired the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, as a security officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 31> 8. 
<line: 32> In addition to the aforesaid negligent acts and/or omissions, the Defendant, 
<line: 33> SILVER LAKE, is vicariously liable for the negligent acts and/or omissions of the Defendant, 
<line: 34> PETER DIANGI, as alleged in Count XIV above. 

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 9. 
<line: 37> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 38> serious physical injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including 
<line: 39> physical and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 41> 10. 
<line: 42> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 43> conduct. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 45> 20

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 21 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 5> against the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 00/100 
<line: 6> DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 8> COUNT XVIII – BATTERY 

[TITLE]
<line: 10> (George Terrell v. Orland Park) 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 13> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count XIV, as 
<line: 14> though fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> 14. 
<line: 17> The conduct and force used by PETER DIANGI as stated herein was intentional, 
<line: 18> malicious, excessive and in reckless disregard of the Plaintiffs' constitutional rights.  Moreover, 
<line: 19> the use of force used against the Plaintiff was excessive. 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> 15. 
<line: 22> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 23> serious injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical 
<line: 24> and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 16. 
<line: 27> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 28> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> 17. 
<line: 31> The Defendant, ORLAND PARK, is vicariously liable for the actionable conduct 
<line: 32> of its employees, agents, and/or servants, including PETER DIANGI. 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 35> against the Defendant, ORLAND PARK, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 
<line: 36> 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate.

<line: 40> (George Terrell v. Orland Park) 

[ABANDON]
<line: 42> 21

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 22 of 26

<line: 5> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count XV, as

<line: 8> 14.

<line: 10> agent, PETER DIANGI, placed Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, in apprehension of immediate 
<line: 11> and imminent harm to his well being and safety, and he suffered great shame and humiliation 
<line: 12> and injury to his dignity and feelings, upsetting him mentally, emotionally and psychologically. 

[TEXT]

<line: 15> against the Defendant, ORLAND PARK, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 
<line: 16> 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 18> COUNT XX – WILLFUL & WANTON 

[TITLE]
<line: 20> (George Terrell v. Peter Diangi) 

[TEXT]
<line: 22> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 23> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count XVI, as 
<line: 24> though fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 14. 
<line: 27> Pursuant to 745 ILCS 10/2-202, police officers are liable for injuries resulting 
<line: 28> from their willful and wanton acts or omissions while engaged in the execution or enforcement 
<line: 29> of the law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 31> 15. 
<line: 32> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI, knew that the 
<line: 33> Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, was legally upon the premises of Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 35> 16. 
<line: 36> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, GEORGE TERRELL was engaged in 
<line: 37> the execution or enforcement of the law when he grabbed and/or struck the Plaintiff, GEORGE 
<line: 38> TERRELL.  Moreover, PETER DIANGI engaged in willful and wanton conduct during said 

[ABANDON]
<line: 40> 22

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 23 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> execution or enforcement of the law by using excessive force in attempting to arrest GEORGE 
<line: 5> TERRELL.    

[TEXT]
<line: 7> 17. 
<line: 8> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 9> serious injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical 
<line: 10> and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 18. 
<line: 13> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 14> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 17> against the Defendant, PETER DIANGI, in a sum in excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 
<line: 18> 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 20> COUNT XXI – WILLFUL & WANTON 

[TITLE]
<line: 22> (George Terrell v. Orland Park) 

[TEXT]
<line: 24> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 25> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count XVII, as 
<line: 26> though fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 28> 14. 
<line: 29> Pursuant to 745 ILCS 10/2-202, municipalities are liable for injuries resulting 
<line: 30> from willful and wanton acts or omissions of police officers while engaged in the execution or 
<line: 31> enforcement of the law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 33> 15. 
<line: 34> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI knew that the 
<line: 35> Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, was lawfully upon the premises of Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 37> 16. 
<line: 38> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI was engaged in the 
<line: 39> execution or enforcement of the law on behalf when he grabbed and/or struck the Plaintiff, 
<line: 40> GEORGE TERRELL.  Moreover, PETER DIANGI engaged in willful and wanton conduct 

[ABANDON]
<line: 42> 23

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 24 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> during said execution or enforcement of the law by using excessive force in attempting to arrest 
<line: 5> GEORGE TERRELL. 

[TEXT]
<line: 7> 17. 
<line: 8> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the ORLAND PARK, by and 
<line: 9> through its employee and/or agent, PETER DIANGI, the Plaintiff suffered serious injuries.  
<line: 10> Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical and emotional 
<line: 11> pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 13> 18. 
<line: 14> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of ORLAND PARK 
<line: 15> aforementioned conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 18> against the Defendant, VILLAGE OF ORLAND PARK, in a sum in excess of FIFTY 
<line: 19> THOUSAND AND 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court might 
<line: 20> deem appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 22> COUNT XXII – 42 U.S.C. §1983 

[TITLE]
<line: 24> (George Terrell) 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 1. through 13.  Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 - 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 27> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of Count XVIII, as 
<line: 28> though fully set forth herein and incorporate the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> 13. 
<line: 31> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI knew that the 
<line: 32> Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, was legally upon the premises of Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> 14. 
<line: 35> At all times set forth in paragraphs 1 – 13, PETER DIANGI was engaged in the 
<line: 36> execution or enforcement of the law, and was acting under the color of authority when he 
<line: 37> engaged in the conduct alleged herein, and when he arrested the Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL.   

[ABANDON]
<line: 39> 24

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 25 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 15. 
<line: 5> The conduct engaged in by GEORGE TERRELL was intentional, malicious, and 
<line: 6> with deliberate indifference to the Plaintiff’s rights under the Constitution.   

[TEXT]
<line: 8> 16. 
<line: 9> The conduct of the Defendants deprived the Plaintiff of the following rights, 
<line: 10> privileges, and immunities secured to him by the Constitution of the United States: 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> a. 
<line: 13> The right of plaintiff to be secure in his person and effects against 
<line: 14> unreasonable search and seizure under the Fourth and Fourteenth Amendments to the 
<line: 15> Constitution of the United States (Art. IV, U.S. Constitution, Art. XIV, U.S. Constitution.); and 
<line: 16> b. 
<line: 17> The right of Plaintiff not to be deprived of life, liberty, or property without 
<line: 18> due process of law, and the right to the equal protection of the laws, secured by the Fourteenth 
<line: 19> Amendment of the Constitution of the United States (Art. XIV, U.S. Constitution). 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> 17. 
<line: 22> Prior to March 18, 2006, ORLAND PARK failed to properly train and supervise 
<line: 23> its officers, including, but not limited to GEORGE TERRELL regarding proper procedures to be 
<line: 24> used in apprehending a suspect, including the proper use of force. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 18. 
<line: 27> In addition, prior to March 18, 2006, ORLAND PARK failed to discipline its 
<line: 28> officers, including, but not limited to PETER DIANGI, following excessive use of force by 
<line: 29> police such that its officers, including, but not limited to PETER DIANGI, were led to believe 
<line: 30> that the consequences of failing to follow proper procedure in the exercise of force were minimal 
<line: 31> or nonexistent. 

[TEXT]
<line: 33> 19. 
<line: 34> As a result of the failure of ORLAND PARK to properly train, supervise and 
<line: 35> discipline its officers, including, but not limited to OF PETER DIANGI, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 36> serious injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including physical 
<line: 37> and emotional pain and suffering. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 39> 25

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 11-2      Filed 06/06/2008     Page 26 of 26

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 20. 
<line: 5> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 6> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> WHEREFORE, the Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 9> against the Defendants, VILLAGE OF ORLAND PARK and PETER DIANGI, in a sum in 
<line: 10> excess of FIFTY THOUSAND AND 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as 
<line: 11> the Court might deem appropriate.
